intro: Virgilia oroboides subsp. ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty virgilia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive reddish or rusty coloration, which gives it its common name. It is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
